intro: Dodecatheon jeffreyi var. alpinum, commonly known as the alpine globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the western United States. It is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in harsh conditions. The species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus, and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
